author: jochembrouwer
content:
Once the fork is live to lift the contract limit (and when I'm back at desk) I want to launch the spamoor to start deploying these "big" contracts so we can stress test the disk I/O. I hope this is ok because this means I will need 30M gas limit txs for it to deploy the max size contracts possible within current gas schedule constraints.

For stress tests, these attacks:
-EXTCODESIZE
-EXTCODECOPY (final byte)
-STATICCALL to JUMPDEST contracts
-STATICCALL via new call frame to reserve enough gas to call a <= 24 KiB contract, but not enough to call anything larger (this is the "free lookup" problem where we do not have the gas to pay for this large disk lookup)

I have to figure out what the max size is going to be for the contracts, I think practically it will be ~140_000 bytes (esp. taking into account these are contracts which are not filled with zeros but are filled with JUMPDESTs)

author: jochembrouwer
content: For the final attack vector (STATICCALL via new call frame with specific gas amount forwarded) I'm rather sure that I can still attempt to call 11k+ contracts, so I fear we need to deploy those first üòÖ

author: .paulharris

author: jochembrouwer
content: Yes that's fine üôÇ I want to start deploying these contracts early though because I need at least 11k blocks for it üò¶
